#### Tender Description (English)

The Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) is seeking input from industry regarding the provision of multi-faith Chaplain services in Immigration Holding Centres (IHCs) for individuals detained under the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA). The information provided will help determine if the services of a multi-faith Chaplain could contribute to the mental health and well-being of individuals held in IHCs, as well as meet the CBSA’s needs.

Industry is requested to provide the following information:

1.  Mandate and organizational structure
2.  Regions and provinces where multi-faith chaplaincy support can be provided
3.  Locations of chaplaincy provision
4.  Accommodation of all faiths through Chaplaincy services
5.  Organizational structure for providing replacement chaplaincy resources
6.  Qualifications of multi-faith Chaplains to ensure effective delivery of multi-faith chaplaincy work
7.  Experience of multi-faith Chaplains in a detention environment
8.  Languages in which Chaplains can provide services
